author: Imam Bukhari
description: The most authentic collection of hadiths compiled by Imam Muhammad ﷺ ibn Ismail al-Bukhari

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: How the Divine Inspiration started
hadiths.textArabic: كَانَ أَوَّلُ مَا بُدِئَ بِهِ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ مِنَ الْوَحْيِ الرُّؤْيَا الصَّالِحَةُ فِي النَّوْمِ، فَكَانَ لَا يَرَى رُؤْيَا إِلَّا جَاءَتْ مِثْلَ فَلَقِ الصُّبْحِ
hadiths.textEnglish: The commencement of the Divine Inspiration to Allah's Messenger was in the form of good dreams which came true like bright daylight, and then the love of seclusion was bestowed upon him.
hadiths.context: This hadith describes how the revelation began for Prophet Muhammad ﷺ (peace be upon him)

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: What is said regarding the deeds of the people of Paradise
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "الإِيمَانُ بِضْعٌ وَسَبْعُونَ شُعْبَةً، فَأَفْضَلُهَا قَوْلُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، وَأَدْنَاهَا إِمَاطَةُ الْأَذَى عَنِ الطَّرِيقِ، وَالْحَيَاءُ شُعْبَةٌ مِنَ الْإِيمَانِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Faith has over seventy branches, and the most excellent of them is the declaration that there is no god but Allah, and the lowest of them is the removal of what is injurious from the path, and modesty is a branch of faith.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains the comprehensive nature of faith and its various branches

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The superiority of knowledge
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "طَلَبُ الْعِلْمِ فَرِيضَةٌ عَلَى كُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Seeking knowledge is obligatory upon every Muslim.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge in Islam

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: How the prayer was prescribed
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "بُنِيَ الْإِسْلَامُ عَلَى خَمْسٍ: شَهَادَةِ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ، وَإِقَامِ الصَّلَاةِ، وَإِيتَاءِ الزَّكَاةِ، وَالْحَجِّ، وَصَوْمِ رَمَضَانَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Islam is built upon five pillars: testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad ﷺ is the Messenger of Allah, establishing prayer, giving zakah, performing Hajj, and fasting in Ramadan.'
hadiths.context: This hadith outlines the five fundamental pillars of Islam

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: What is said regarding the saying of Allah
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "لَا يُؤْمِنُ أَحَدُكُمْ حَتَّى يُحِبَّ لِأَخِيهِ مَا يُحِبُّ لِنَفْسِهِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'None of you will have faith until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches the importance of loving others as we love ourselves

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The superiority of the prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "أَرَأَيْتُمْ لَوْ أَنَّ نَهَرًا بِبَابِ أَحَدِكُمْ يَغْتَسِلُ فِيهِ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ خَمْسَ مَرَّاتٍ، هَلْ يَبْقَى مِنْ دَرَنِهِ شَيْءٌ؟" قَالُوا: لَا يَبْقَى مِنْ دَرَنِهِ شَيْءٌ. قَالَ: "فَذَلِكَ مَثَلُ الصَّلَوَاتِ الْخَمْسِ، يَمْحُو اللَّهُ بِهِنَّ الْخَطَايَا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'What do you think if there was a river at the door of one of you and he bathed in it five times a day, would there remain any dirt on him?' They said: 'No dirt would remain on him.' He said: 'That is the parable of the five prayers. Allah wipes away sins with them.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains how the five daily prayers purify a person from sins

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The obligation of fasting
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ صَامَ رَمَضَانَ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and in the hope of reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the spiritual benefits of fasting in Ramadan

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The obligation of Zakah
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ آتَى زَكَاةَ مَالِهِ طَاهِرَةً مِنْ قَلْبِهِ، فَلَا يَضُرُّهُ مَا أَخَذَ مِنْهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever gives zakah on his wealth with a pure heart, it will not harm him what is taken from him.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains the spiritual benefits of giving zakah with sincerity

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The obligation of Hajj
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ حَجَّ فَلَمْ يَرْفُثْ وَلَمْ يَفْسُقْ رَجَعَ كَيَوْمِ وَلَدَتْهُ أُمُّهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit any obscenity or transgression, he will return as if he were born anew.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the spiritual purification achieved through proper Hajj

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 1: The superiority of Jihad
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ مَاتَ وَلَمْ يَغْزُ وَلَمْ يُحَدِّثْ نَفْسَهُ بِالْغَزْوِ مَاتَ عَلَى شُعْبَةٍ مِنْ نِفَاقٍ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever dies without having fought or having thought of fighting, dies on a branch of hypocrisy.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of being prepared to defend Islam

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The times of prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِنَّ بَيْنَ الرَّجُلِ وَبَيْنَ الشِّرْكِ وَالْكُفْرِ تَرْكُ الصَّلَاةِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Between a man and polytheism and disbelief is the abandonment of prayer.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the critical importance of prayer in maintaining faith

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The excellence of knowledge and its transmission
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ سَلَكَ طَرِيقًا يَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ عِلْمًا سَهَّلَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِهِ طَرِيقًا إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever takes a path in search of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him the path to Paradise.'
hadiths.context: This hadith highlights the great reward for seeking knowledge

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 2: The excellence of fasting
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "الصِّيَامُ جُنَّةٌ، فَإِذَا كَانَ يَوْمُ صَوْمِ أَحَدِكُمْ فَلَا يَرْفُثْ وَلَا يَصْخَبْ، فَإِنْ سَابَّهُ أَحَدٌ أَوْ قَاتَلَهُ فَلْيَقُلْ إِنِّي صَائِمٌ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Fasting is a shield. When one of you is fasting, he should not use foul language or raise his voice. If someone insults him or fights with him, he should say: I am fasting.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches proper behavior during fasting

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of visiting the sick
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "حَقُّ الْمُسْلِمِ عَلَى الْمُسْلِمِ خَمْسٌ: رَدُّ السَّلَامِ، وَعِيَادَةُ الْمَرِيضِ، وَاتِّبَاعُ الْجَنَائِزِ، وَإِجَابَةُ الدَّعْوَةِ، وَتَشْمِيتُ الْعَاطِسِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'A Muslim has five rights over another Muslim: to return the greeting, to visit the sick, to follow the funeral processions, to accept the invitation, and to respond to the sneezer.'
hadiths.context: This hadith outlines the mutual rights and responsibilities between Muslims

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of congregational prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "صَلَاةُ الرَّجُلِ فِي الْجَمَاعَةِ تُضَعَّفُ عَلَى صَلَاتِهِ فِي بَيْتِهِ وَفِي سُوقِهِ خَمْسًا وَعِشْرِينَ ضِعْفًا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'A man's prayer in congregation is twenty-five times more rewarding than his prayer in his house or in the marketplace.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the great reward of praying in congregation

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of saying 'La ilaha illa Allah'
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ قَالَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، فِي يَوْمٍ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ، كَانَتْ لَهُ عَدْلَ عَشْرِ رِقَابٍ، وَكُتِبَتْ لَهُ مِائَةُ حَسَنَةٍ، وَمُحِيَتْ عَنْهُ مِائَةُ سَيِّئَةٍ، وَكَانَتْ لَهُ حِرْزًا مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ يَوْمَهُ ذَلِكَ حَتَّى يُمْسِيَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever says: La ilaha illa Allah, wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa huwa ala kulli shay'in qadir (There is no god but Allah, alone, with no partner, to Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is capable of all things) one hundred times in a day, it will be equal to freeing ten slaves, and one hundred good deeds will be written for him, and one hundred bad deeds will be erased from him, and it will be a protection for him from Satan on that day until evening.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great benefits of regular dhikr

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of good character
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَا مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَثْقَلُ فِي الْمِيزَانِ مِنْ حُسْنِ الْخُلُقِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Nothing is heavier on the scale than good character.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of good character in the Hereafter

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of teaching knowledge
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِذَا مَاتَ الْإِنْسَانُ انْقَطَعَ عَنْهُ عَمَلُهُ إِلَّا مِنْ ثَلَاثَةٍ: إِلَّا مِنْ صَدَقَةٍ جَارِيَةٍ، أَوْ عِلْمٍ يُنْتَفَعُ بِهِ، أَوْ وَلَدٍ صَالِحٍ يَدْعُو لَهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When a person dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: ongoing charity, knowledge that is beneficial, or a righteous child who prays for him.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains what continues to benefit a person after death

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of the night prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "أَفْضَلُ الصَّلَاةِ بَعْدَ الْفَرِيضَةِ صَلَاةُ اللَّيْلِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The best prayer after the obligatory prayers is the night prayer.'
hadiths.context: This hadith highlights the excellence of voluntary night prayers

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 3: The excellence of fasting on Mondays and Thursdays
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "تُعْرَضُ الْأَعْمَالُ يَوْمَ الِاثْنَيْنِ وَالْخَمِيسِ، فَأُحِبُّ أَنْ يُعْرَضَ عَمَلِي وَأَنَا صَائِمٌ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Deeds are presented on Mondays and Thursdays, and I love for my deeds to be presented while I am fasting.'
hadiths.context: This hadith explains why the Prophet ﷺ fasted on Mondays and Thursdays

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 5: The excellence of truthfulness
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِنَّ الصِّدْقَ يَهْدِي إِلَى الْبِرِّ، وَإِنَّ الْبِرَّ يَهْدِي إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ، وَإِنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَيَصْدُقُ حَتَّى يُكْتَبَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ صِدِّيقًا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Truthfulness leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise. A person continues to be truthful until he is recorded with Allah as truthful.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of truthfulness and its spiritual benefits

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 5: The excellence of the Friday prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنِ اغْتَسَلَ يَوْمَ الْجُمُعَةِ غُسْلَ الْجَنَابَةِ ثُمَّ رَاحَ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَرَّبَ بَدَنَةً، وَمَنْ رَاحَ فِي السَّاعَةِ الثَّانِيَةِ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَرَّبَ بَقَرَةً، وَمَنْ رَاحَ فِي السَّاعَةِ الثَّالِثَةِ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَرَّبَ كَبْشًا أَقْرَنَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever takes a bath on Friday like the bath for ceremonial purity, then goes to the mosque, it is as if he offered a camel in sacrifice; and whoever goes in the second hour, it is as if he offered a cow; and whoever goes in the third hour, it is as if he offered a ram with horns.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for attending Friday prayer early

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of seeking knowledge from the cradle to the grave
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ خَرَجَ فِي طَلَبِ الْعِلْمِ فَهُوَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever goes out in search of knowledge is in the path of Allah until he returns.'
hadiths.context: This hadith shows that seeking knowledge is considered a form of jihad

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 6: The excellence of visiting the sick
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِنَّ الْمُسْلِمَ إِذَا عَادَ أَخَاهُ الْمُسْلِمَ لَمْ يَزَلْ فِي خُرْفَةِ الْجَنَّةِ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When a Muslim visits his sick Muslim brother, he remains in the harvest of Paradise until he returns.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for visiting the sick

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 6: The excellence of the dawn prayer
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ صَلَّى الصُّبْحَ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا صَلَّى اللَّيْلَ كُلَّهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever prays the dawn prayer in congregation, it is as if he prayed the entire night.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the special reward of the dawn prayer in congregation

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 4: The excellence of fasting six days in Shawwal
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ صَامَ رَمَضَانَ ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَهُ سِتًّا مِنْ شَوَّالٍ كَانَ كَصِيَامِ الدَّهْرِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever fasts Ramadan and then follows it with six days of Shawwal, it will be as if he fasted the entire year.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the reward for fasting six days after Ramadan

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 7: The excellence of good treatment of parents
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "رَغِمَ أَنْفُ رَجُلٍ ذُكِرْتُ عِنْدَهُ فَلَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَيَّ، وَرَغِمَ أَنْفُ رَجُلٍ دَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ رَمَضَانُ ثُمَّ انْسَلَخَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُغْفَرَ لَهُ، وَرَغِمَ أَنْفُ رَجُلٍ أَدْرَكَ عِنْدَهُ أَبَوَاهُ الْكِبَرَ فَلَمْ يُدْخِلَاهُ الْجَنَّةَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'May his nose be rubbed in dust - a man in whose presence I am mentioned and he does not send blessings upon me; and may his nose be rubbed in dust - a man who enters Ramadan and it ends before he is forgiven; and may his nose be rubbed in dust - a man whose parents reach old age in his presence and they do not cause him to enter Paradise.'
hadiths.context: This hadith emphasizes the importance of treating parents well

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 7: The excellence of the two rak'ahs before Fajr
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "رَكْعَتَا الْفَجْرِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا وَمَا فِيهَا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The two rak'ahs before Fajr are better than the world and everything in it.'
hadiths.context: This hadith shows the immense value of the two sunnah rak'ahs before Fajr

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 8: The excellence of good treatment of neighbors
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلَا يُؤْذِي جَارَهُ، وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلْيُكْرِمْ ضَيْفَهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not harm his neighbor, and whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his guest.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches proper treatment of neighbors and guests

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 5: The excellence of teaching others
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "مَنْ دَعَا إِلَى هُدًى كَانَ لَهُ مِنَ الْأَجْرِ مِثْلُ أُجُورِ مَنْ تَبِعَهُ لَا يَنْقُصُ ذَلِكَ مِنْ أُجُورِهِمْ شَيْئًا"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever calls to guidance will have a reward like that of those who follow him, without that diminishing their rewards in the slightest.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the great reward for calling others to guidance

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 6: The excellence of seeking forgiveness
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "وَاللَّهِ إِنِّي لَأَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ فِي الْيَوْمِ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةً"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'By Allah, I seek forgiveness from Allah and repent to Him more than seventy times a day.'
hadiths.context: This hadith shows how frequently the Prophet ﷺ sought forgiveness

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 8: The excellence of ablution
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِذَا تَوَضَّأَ الْعَبْدُ الْمُسْلِمُ أَوِ الْمُؤْمِنُ فَغَسَلَ وَجْهَهُ خَرَجَ مِنْ وَجْهِهِ كُلُّ خَطِيئَةٍ نَظَرَ إِلَيْهَا بِعَيْنَيْهِ مَعَ الْمَاءِ أَوْ مَعَ آخِرِ قَطْرِ الْمَاءِ، فَإِذَا غَسَلَ يَدَيْهِ خَرَجَ مِنْ يَدَيْهِ كُلُّ خَطِيئَةٍ بَطَشَتْهَا يَدَاهُ مَعَ الْمَاءِ أَوْ مَعَ آخِرِ قَطْرِ الْمَاءِ، فَإِذَا غَسَلَ رِجْلَيْهِ خَرَجَتْ كُلُّ خَطِيئَةٍ مَشَتْهَا رِجْلَاهُ مَعَ الْمَاءِ أَوْ مَعَ آخِرِ قَطْرِ الْمَاءِ حَتَّى يَخْرُجَ نَقِيًّا مِنَ الذُّنُوبِ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When a Muslim or believer performs ablution and washes his face, every sin he looked at with his eyes comes out from his face with the water or with the last drop of water. When he washes his hands, every sin his hands committed comes out from his hands with the water or with the last drop of water. When he washes his feet, every sin his feet walked comes out from his feet with the water or with the last drop of water, until he comes out pure from sins.'
hadiths.context: This hadith describes the spiritual purification achieved through proper ablution

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 9: The excellence of mentioning Allah before eating and sleeping
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِذَا أَكَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَذْكُرِ اسْمَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى، فَإِنْ نَسِيَ أَنْ يَذْكُرَ اسْمَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى فِي أَوَّلِهِ فَلْيَقُلْ: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ أَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When one of you eats, let him mention the name of Allah. If he forgets to mention the name of Allah at the beginning, let him say: In the name of Allah at the beginning and the end.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches the proper way to mention Allah before eating

hadiths.chapter: Chapter 10: The excellence of supplication before sleeping
hadiths.textArabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: "إِذَا أَوَى أَحَدُكُمْ إِلَى فِرَاشِهِ فَلْيَنْفُضْ فِرَاشَهُ بِدَاخِلَةِ إِزَارِهِ فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَدْرِي مَا خَلَفَهُ عَلَيْهِ، ثُمَّ يَقُولُ: بِاسْمِكَ رَبِّي وَضَعْتُ جَنْبِي، وَبِكَ أَرْفَعُهُ، فَإِنْ أَمْسَكْتَ نَفْسِي فَارْحَمْهَا، وَإِنْ أَرْسَلْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا بِمَا تَحْفَظُ بِهِ عِبَادَكَ الصَّالِحِينَ"
hadiths.textEnglish: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When one of you goes to his bed, let him dust off his bed with the inside of his garment, for he does not know what has come onto it after him. Then let him say: In Your name, my Lord, I lie down and in Your name I rise, so if You should take my soul then have mercy upon it, and if You should return my soul then protect it in the manner You do so with Your righteous servants.'
hadiths.context: This hadith teaches the proper supplication and action before sleeping
